Memory Monitor Module

Cross-platform memory monitoring utilities for Nim programs. Provides functions to get process RAM usage and system memory information.

Example:

import memonitor

let memInfo = getMemInfo()
echo "Process uses: ", memInfo.processRamMB, " MB"
echo "System has: ", memInfo.freeRamMB, " MB free"

# Monitor memory usage around some operation
let before = getProcessRamMB()
# ... do memory-intensive work ...
let after = getProcessRamMB()
echo "Memory increased by: ", after - before, " MB"

Types

MemInfo = object
  processRamMB*: float       ## Process RAM usage in MB (-1 if unable to determine)
  freeRamMB*: float          ## System free RAM in MB (-1 if unable to determine)
  totalRamMB*: float         ## Total system RAM in MB (-1 if unable to determine)
  usedSystemPercent*: float  ## Percentage of system RAM used (-1 if unable to determine)
Memory information structure Source   Edit

                             tags: [ExecIOEffect, ReadIOEffect, RootEffect],
                             forbids: [].}
Get complete memory information for both process and system. This is the main function to use for comprehensive memory monitoring. Source   Edit   
proc getNimMemInfo(): tuple[used, free: int] {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get Nim's internal memory statistics if available Returns (-1, -1) if not available Source   Edit   
proc getProcessRamMB(): float {....raises: [],
                                tags: [ExecIOEffect, ReadIOEffect, RootEffect],
                                forbids: [].}
Get current process RAM usage in megabytes. Returns -1.0 if unable to determine. Source   Edit   
proc getSystemMemMB(): tuple[free, total: float] {....raises: [],
    tags: [ExecIOEffect, ReadIOEffect, RootEffect], forbids: [].}
Get system memory information in megabytes. Returns (free_ram, total_ram) tuple. Returns (-1.0, -1.0) if unable to determine. Source   Edit

    tags: [ExecIOEffect, ReadIOEffect, RootEffect], forbids: [].}

Templates

template withMemoryMonitoring(body: untyped): untyped

Template to monitor memory usage around a block of code Usage:

withMemoryMonitoring:
  # Your memory-intensive code here
  var data = newSeq[int](1000000)
